# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here's a Julia function that fulfills this task:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(replace(col, " " => "_"))), "-" => "_")
end
clean_column("My Column")
```
This function first removes leading and trailing whitespaces with the `strip` function. Then it converts all characters to lower case using `lowercase`. After that, any spaces or hyphens are replaced with underscores using `replace`. 

When you call this function with "My Column", like in the example below, it will return "my_column".
